TopicTitle: [0.14+][ver 1.1]Wacky Wood Wares! - Cartoony Parts for increased Kerbalness

Articles.Content:
Sorry guy for keeping You waiting, got some new part in stash but since new part format has been released ive decided to remake all of them to match new KSP style.

Hello fellow Kerbanauts!

I hereby annouce development of Wacky Wood Wares mod!

Found vanilla parts looking to serious?

Craving for some cartoony, irrational things orbiting around Kerbin?

Well wait no more - the WWW will fulfill Your needs!

Part list:

- Custom decoupler

- Tricoupler

- Wooden plank (as a strut)

- Autogyro ( Adv S.A.S)

- Landing Foot

- Oven Engine

- Clothing Iron ( RCS block)

- old Whiskey Barrel

- Ridiculously Big Firework rocket

- Wooden Winglet

- Wooden radial decoupler

- Gas Container (rcs fuel)

- Wooden Command Pod

- Custom Parachute

- Huge Fuel Silo that comes in 3 parts

-'The Roaster' engine that kicks like mule on steroids.

Here\'s what it looks like.

Changelog:

1.1- added big fuel silo and huge engine (also fixed looks for crew pod)

1.0 - initial release

DOWNLOAD:

Wacky Wood Wares 1.1
Well played, sir. Well played.
In a good way?
This is brilliant!
Indeed, quite excellent looking cartoon parts!
Epic. Sir, you have won KSP!
This totally changes the environment of the game, and it\'s definitely in a good way! I love the cartoon-ishness of the pack!

Thanks Guys!

Im going to keep up the good work then .
This looks awesome, indeed. I\'d like to see a sausage powered rocket in there somewhere, and perhaps a Mun made of cheese.
It\'s... beautiful...

That reminds me so much of an area at Disney I went to as a child. Well done lol. Idea for a 'Booster' Make a slingshot that has two posts on either side of the rocket (if they made a line it would be perpendicular to the vehicle-tower line. At the bottom of the rocket would be a sling, and it would be labeled as a SRB. When you launch it pushes the rocket up with thrust but with no flame effect, to give the illusion it is being slinged upward, and detach once the bottom of the rocket is level with the posts. If you used an auto stage mechanism it would be flawless with the only hard part being the posts and tubing connecting the two. I am not sure how easy it would be but I cant see it being THAT hard.

The duration would have to be just a second or something, though, and animations would require plugin support IIRC.

I may be misinterpreting you.
Yeah it would need a plugin and the duration would be for a second or two, but it would be rather forceful. Just an idea I have no idea on the logistics.
this Is AWESOME! very nice work!

Basic (Angry Birds) slingshot idea:

1 Model when it\'s ready to fire, with an attachment node for the rocket

1 Model when fired

A plugin that changes the model, decouples the rocket from it and pushes it away

You didn\'t get it, haha
Reminds me of Dr Snuggles

Wow, g(o)od job. 8)

*g(o)d job is greatest mark what you can earn from me
haha good show good quality and common theme. A++

I\'d like to make a recommendation: you should put a note next to the download link to make sure people click on the correct download button, because the ads often have one that isn\'t for the actual file. The actual download button is the one at the bottom, by the way.

I\'d like to make a recommendation: you should put a note next to the download link to make sure people click on the correct download button, because the ads often have one that isn\'t for the actual file. The actual download button is the one at the bottom, by the way.

I went to the site to see what you were talking about and only saw the one download button that actually downloaded the correct file.

AdBlock FTW!

Excellent work btw! I love the cartooniness of the whole thing. Very Kerbal.

Cheers!

Capt\'n Skunky

KSP Community Manager

I don\'t use adblock, so I see the ads in the middle of the page.

I reloaded about eight times just out of curiosity; five times I got a fake download button, twice I got an assortment of other buttons, and once I got a fake Captcha...

I\'ll put in my dropbox instead. Will be better for fast updates too.
Haha this is great!
